body:
### Problem

My startup time has gotten pretty slow suddenly.

I've run --startuptime and feel like I have it pinned to the sourcing of `clipboard.vim`.
```
times in msec
 clock   self+sourced   self:  sourced script
 clock   elapsed:              other lines

696.473  678.234  678.234: sourcing /usr/share/nvim/runtime/autoload/provider/clipboard.vim
696.492  000.086: before starting main loop
696.691  000.199: first screen update
696.693  000.002: --- NVIM STARTED ---
```





### Steps to reproduce

```bash
nvim
```

### Expected behavior

Relatively fast startup, I mean I'm not using VS$%!@#

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.10.0-dev-1438+g8405649f9

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

No, Vim starts up very fast

### Operating system/version

WSL2 Ubuntu 22.04.2 LTS

### Terminal name/version

Windows Terminal

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

Build from source

I ran a profile as well
[profile.txt](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/files/13343647/profile.txt)

title: Startup on WSL2 suddenly slow
